intro: Leptocarpus peronatus var. hirtellus, commonly known as the hairy leptocarpus, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in coastal or sandy soils, often in heathland environments. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine, soft hairs, which contribute to its common name. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
